This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The purpose of this project is to conserve the critically endangered Cao Vit gibbon by demonstrating approaches to habitat restoration; piloting a seed-fund to support conservation–friendly livelihood activities; and maintaining and strengthening trans-boundary cooperation for gibbon conservation between Vietnam and China. Specifically, this will be done by: 1) preparing detailed site-based plans for habitat restoration by making a survey of each priority site, completing a plan for each priority site, and having the plans approved by the nature reserve; 2) providing a two-day training for forestry and nature reserve staff on habitat restoration; 3) collecting forest tree seeds and using them to establish a nursery as close to the planting site as possible; 4) planting trees on degraded land not conducive to natural regeneration; 5) carrying out assisted natural regeneration techniques to promote seedling growth; 6) piloting alternative livelihoods (therefore cultivation of medicinal plants) to reduce pressure on the nature reserve through scoping and identification of pilot sites; 7) monitoring the pilot sites at least every two months and evaluating the prospects of them providing alternative livelihoods for local people; and 8) maintaining and strengthening trans-boundary cooperation between Vietnam and China by carrying out a study tour to allow Chinese and Vietnamese officials to exchange lessons learned and experiences..
